en: This procedure is to verify that the Keystone device or firmware has not been tampered with.
Please access the link stated below. Click the #F5870A Verify Device# button to initiate the process.
Scan the QR code generated on the website to obtain your device verification code.
Enter the code on the website to check whether the device has been compromised or not.
Input this verification code on the Device Verification page of Keystone's official website to authenticate the device.
Your device has potentially been breached, putting your sensitive data and digital assets at risk. For safety, erase all personal data and contact our Customer Service team immediately.
Unable to recognize QR code information
To take advantage of the latest features, make sure to update your firmware to the most recent version.
Ensure that your Keystone has at least 20% battery life remaining.
Navigate to Keystone's firmware update page using your computer or mobile.
Connect Keystone to your computer with a USB-C cable.
Tap the #F5870A Install Update# button on the webpage and follow the instructions to install the latest firmware.
Do not unplug the USB cable while the installation process is underway.
Once connected, the external device will have the necessary authorization to transfer data to your Keystone.
Do not unplug the USB cable while the installation process is underway.
Ensure that your Keystone has at least 20% battery life remaining.
Transfer the firmware file (keystone3.bin) onto your Keystone using MicroSD card (formatted in FAT32).
Please ensure that you've inserted a FAT32-formatted MicroSD card with the firmware into the device.
The copying process of the latest firmware from the MicroSD card may take 15 to 45 seconds.
A new firmware version is available. Do you want to update your device's firmware to version v1.3.0?
The MicroSD card is not recognized. The current device requires formatting the MicroSD card for re-recognition.
The device needs a minimum of 20% battery life to continue the process
Create a new wallet or import an existing wallet using it's seed phrase.
The PIN code will be utilized to unlock your wallet and authorize transactions.
The password will be used to unlock your wallet and authorize transactions.
Repeat and confirm the PIN code you've entered.
Double confirm the password you've entered.
Assign a name to your wallet and select an icon to make it easily distinguishable.
Select the preferred method for backing up your seed phrase.
12 or 24 seed phrase backup. Most commonly used method.
An advanced procedure for securely storing your seed phrase.

Shamir backup is a high-security method for a seed phrase. It splits the seed phrase into multiple pieces and determines how many pieces are needed to restore the phrase. You can control the number of individuals required to be involved in order to restore the backup to the entire seed phrase.
Having your seed phrase in someone else's possession grants them complete access to your assets.
Please make sure there are no onlookers or cameras when you record your seed phrase.
Write down your seed phrase in the card and keep it properly
Tap words below in the order of your Seed phrase to confirm that you have kept it properly.
The phrase order is incorrect. Please check your backup and try again
The device needs a minimum of 20% battery life to continue the process
Please confirm you are the custodian of the Share
Anyone with your seed phrase has full access to your cryptocurrency.
Please make sure there are no onlookers or cameras when you record your seed phrase.
Write down your Share 1 phrase and keep it properly.
Select words below in the order of your Share #F5870A 1# phrase to confirm that you have kept it properly.
The seed phrase of this Share is verified successfully, now proceed to the next share.
Tap the button below and hand it over to the second share custodian who keeps Share 2.
The phrase order is incorrect. Please check your backup and try again
Are you sure you want to cancel the process? The confirmed Shares will be lost after canceling.
Input the seed phrase in the blanks provided below.
The phrase you typed is invalid. Please check your backup and try again
Input the 20-word seed phrase for Share 1 in the blanks provided below.
The Share already entered, please enter a different Share.
The Share you entered is not belong to this backup. Please check your backup and try again.
You will be required to re-enter all the Shares after canceling.
Scan the QR code with your software wallet
This PIN code will be used to unlock your wallet and sign transactions.
If you forget it, you’ll have to verify the seed phrase of this wallet to reset the passcode.
Repeat and confirm the PIN code you’ve just typed.
Your passcode has been reset successfully.
Display a shortcut entry for Passphrase when powered on
The passphrase is an additional layer of security on top of your backup.
Entering a different passphrase will always generate a different wallet.
To recover your wallet, both the passphrase and seed phrase are required.
If you forget your passphrase, you can no longer access your coins.
Input your seed phrase to verify if it matches your current wallet.
Invalid seed phrase. Please try again.
Keystone supports a maximum of #F5870A 3# different wallets.
You should set a #F5870A different passcode# for each wallet
For your security, we will not display the wallet list anywhere. The #F5870A only way# to switch wallets is to unlock the device with the corresponding passcode.
To safeguard your digital assets, it is advisable to verify the seed phrase before proceeding with its deletion.
All data stored on this device, including all of your wallets, will be permanently deleted.

Please double confirm that by continue
all data stored on this device, including all of your wallets, will be permanently deleted.
Do not power off your device while the installation process is underway
When disabled, the usb can only be used for charging battery
This address is exclusively for BTC transactions only. Sending other types of digital assets to this address will result in their loss.
What are the three different address formats for BTC?

Bitcoin (BTC) uses three address formats for receiving funds:
1. Native SegWit is the most efficient and secure Bitcoin address format. It provides cost savings and improved security compared to other traditional address formats,typically starting with "bc1"
2. Legacy address format is one of the earliest versions of Bitcoin, typically starting with "1"
3. Nested SegWit is a solution designed to facilitate the transition to Native SegWit in a smooth manner, typically starting with "3"
What are the three different address formats for BTC?
Can the three different address formats be used to transfer funds to each other?

Yes, the three distinct Bitcoin address formats can be used for transferring funds among each other. However, it’s important to keep in mind the following aspects:
1. Differing transaction fees: The choice of address format can influence transaction fees, with Native SegWit addresses generally having lower fees.
2. Wallet and exchange compatibility: Make sure that the wallet or exchange you are using supports your chosen address format. Some wallets may only be compatible with specific address formats.
Can the three different address formats be used to transfer funds to each other?

1. Privacy: Reusing addresses increases transaction traceability, endangering privacy. New addresses help maintain transaction privacy.
2. Transaction Efficiency: Multiple UTXOs linked to one address can raise costs for consolidation, impacting wallet efficiency.
3. Security: Repeated address use heightens the risk of private key exposure, potentially leading to losses if compromised.
In short, not reusing addresses safeguards privacy, optimizes transactions, and reduces security risks within the UTXO model.
This address is only for ETH and EVM ERC-20 tokens, other digital assets sent to this address will be lost.
Select the derivation path you’d like to use for Ethereum
Recommend. Most commonly used in many software wallets.
Exploring Differences: Standard, Ledger Live, and Legacy Derivation Paths in Ethereum

1. Standard Path: This path is widely employed by numerous software wallets for address generation. Examples of such wallets encompass MetaMask, Rabby, BitKeep, and Core Wallet.
2. Ledger Live: Choose this path if you intend to import a seed phrase from Ledger Live. Please note that Keystone supports synchronizing only the initial 10 addresses using this format.
3. Ledger Legacy: Transition to this path if you manage your digital assets with Ledger Legacy
Exploring Differences: Standard, Ledger Live, and Legacy Derivation Paths in Ethereum

BTC transactions, based on the UTXO mechanism, allocate some assets to a change address during transfers. This address is generated by the software wallet for anonymity and privacy purposes. You don't need to worry since the change address belongs to your own account, and its amount will be used automatically in subsequent transactions.
